text: I dont think there is. It would just display a thumbnail/preview of the video. What we have done is to add an extra Image Field which will serve as a custom thumbnail
Edit: never mind. Changed the partial to a module. But how to access the (form) fieldpath in an island?

You guys did a good job developing this React thingy. Itâ€™s actually faster developing websites like this compared to using Headless CMS like Sanity. There is a little bit more involved there since you need to implement modules on the frontend and within the CMS as well.

This is more streamlined. Like it :slightly_smiling_face:
Are you trying to use the <Form /> component?
Yes! I did within the Island. Just using the fieldPath which I did set in the fields.tsx of the module
Should be valid since it says it is shown on the page.
is your form field in a field group?

This is starting to get an issue though. Followed some advice here to wrap every module in a Layout/TailwindCSS component. But now my dev tools is also so slow for some reason :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

when i console log fieldValues, which I have been passing down to the Island, I can see all the data there, including the form object with the formId.

I did an inspect element to see if maybe there is a display: none; or missing styling, but it is just an empty Form wrapper without any rendered fields
It would be actually nice if we could just pass in the formId so we can use the Form component in partials as well

Just FYI for the documentation site...the property names in the table on this page, <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/reference/islands.html>, appear to be invisible but for some reason have a white text color applied to them:


I attached images of me highlighting the text and then without highlighting
We put our tailwind import in a dedicated module which is imported once, via the base html template.
Then when working locally, we have a dev version of each module which is wrapped in an AppWrapper component. Works well with minimal extra code
